de.ovgu.softwareprojekt.networking

Class PsychicServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.ovgu.softwareprojekt.networking.AbstractPsychicServer
      • de.ovgu.softwareprojekt.networking.PsychicServer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ButtonListener, ClientListener, ResetListener, OnCommandListener, ExceptionListener, ClientLossListener

    public class PsychicServer
extends AbstractPsychicServer
    This subclass of AbstractPsychicServer can be used if you only want to know about specific callbacks, or cannot subclass AbstractPsychicServer. The server will accept all clients, unless acceptClient(NetworkDevice) is overridden or a ClientListener is set using setClientListener(ClientListener).

    • Constructor Detail

      • PsychicServer

        public PsychicServer(@Nullable
                     java.lang.String serverName,
                     int discoveryPort)
        Create a new server. It will be offline (not using any sockets) until AbstractPsychicServer.start() is called.
        Parameters:
        serverName - if not null, this name will be used. otherwise, the devices hostname is used
        discoveryPort - the port that should be listened on to discover devices

      • PsychicServer

        public PsychicServer(java.lang.String serverName)
        Create a new server. It will be offline (not using any sockets) until AbstractPsychicServer.start() is called. The discovery port is defaulted to port 8888
        Parameters:
        serverName - the name this server will be discoverable as

      • PsychicServer

        public PsychicServer(int discoveryPort)
        Create a new server. It will be offline (not using any sockets) until AbstractPsychicServer.start() is called. The device hostname will be used as server name.
        Parameters:
        discoveryPort - the discovery port to use

      • PsychicServer

        public PsychicServer()
        Create a new server. It will be offline (not using any sockets) until AbstractPsychicServer.start() is called. Port 8888 will be used as the discovery port, and the device hostname will be used as server name.

    • Method Detail

      • setClientListener

        public void setClientListener(@Nullable
                              ClientListener clientListener)
        Set the listener for client events. If functions of this interface are overridden in child classes, the client listener is no longer called by them.
        Parameters:
        clientListener - the new client listener

      • setResetListener

        public void setResetListener(@Nullable
                             ResetListener resetListener)
        Set the listener for reset button events. If functions of this interface are overridden in child classes, the reset listener is no longer called by them.
        Parameters:
        resetListener - the new client listener

        Parameters:

                                 ExceptionListener exceptionListener)
        Set the listener for exception events. If functions of this interface are overridden in child classes, the exception listener is no longer called by them.
        Parameters:
        exceptionListener - the new client listener

      • onResetPosition

        public void onResetPosition(NetworkDevice origin)
        Called when the user presses the reset position button. If overridden, the reset listener (if set) will no longer be called
        Parameters:
        origin - which device pressed the button

      • acceptClient

        public boolean acceptClient(NetworkDevice newClient)
        Check whether a new client should be accepted
        Parameters:
        newClient - the new clients identification
        Returns:
        true if the client should be accepted, false otherwise

      • onClientDisconnected

        public void onClientDisconnected(NetworkDevice disconnectedClient)
        Called when a client sent a disconnect signal
        Parameters:
        disconnectedClient - the lost client

      • onClientTimeout

        public void onClientTimeout(NetworkDevice timeoutClient)
        Called when a client hasn't responded to connection check requests within 500ms
        Parameters:
        timeoutClient - the client that did not respond

      • onClientAccepted

        public void onClientAccepted(NetworkDevice connectedClient)
        called when a Client is successfully connected
        Parameters:
        connectedClient - the client that connected successfully

      • onButtonClick

        public void onButtonClick(ButtonClick click,
                          NetworkDevice origin)
        Called whenever a button is clicked
        Parameters:
        click - event object specifying details like button id
        origin - the network device that sent the button click

      • onException

        public void onException(java.lang.Object origin,
                        java.lang.Exception exception,
                        java.lang.String info)
        Called when an exception cannot be gracefully handled.
        Parameters:
        origin - the instance (or, if it is a hidden instance, the known parent) that produced the exception
        exception - the exception that was thrown
        info - additional information to help identify the problem
